c74object.name: j.in~
c74object.description: j.in~ is an input conduit for audio signals in a Jamoma model (much like j.in is for control signals). It allows to turn on or off audio signal sent to the model or bypass audio signal processing in the model when used in combination with j.out~. It also passes parameters or messages value changes sent to the model inlet to the addressed parameter or message
c74object.discussion:
Audio input and output management provided by j.in~ and j.out~ are part of the services enabled by the amenities feature of a Jamoma model. When a model's amenities attribute is set to all or audio, several nodes are created under the model namespace so these features can be remotely accessed.
When enable, j.in~ or j.out~ creates an audio/mute node. This internal parameter allows to toggle audio signal input and output of the model.
When used in combination, paired j.in~ and j.out~ create an audio/bypass node. When set to 1, this internal parameter allows to sent audio signal coming at the model input straight to its output (that is, without passing through the whole audio processing chain of the model).
The use of j.in~ and j.out~ also creates audio/in.<instance name> and audio/out.<instance name> respectively, allowing to remotely send or receive audio signal to a model input or output.
When amenities is set to none, these features provided by j.in~ and j.out~ are disabled and the internal parameters are removed from the model's namespace.

outlet.digest: Signal to send to model core
outlet.description: Signal to send to model core

objarg.name: instance name
objarg.digest: Instance name to subscribe input in Jamoma model namespace
objarg.description:
An argument set to j.in~ sets an instance name to subscribe input in the model namespace. The full address of this node will be <model name>/audio/in.<argument>
It also sets the name of a j.out to pair with

method.name: anything
method.digest: Signal to send to the model
method.description:
Incoming audio signal is output at j.in~ leftmost outlet. When the incoming message matches a parameter or message name in the model, the value(s) attached as argument to this message are forwarded to the addressed parameter in the model.
When paired with a j.out~ object whose bypass attribute is set to 1, audio signal coming at j.in~ inlet is silenced from its outlet and directly sent to j.out~

method.name: dump
method.description: The dump message outputs all attributes value out of j.in~ rightmost outlet

attribute.name: bypass
attribute.digest: Send incoming audio signal to paired j.out~ and turn off output
attribute.description: The bypass attribute toggles incoming signal output. When set to 0 (default), incoming signal is output at j.in~ leftmost outlet. When set to 1, incoming signal is sent to paired j.out~ object in the model. This attribute is internally linked to the model's parameter audio/bypass

attribute.name: mute
attribute.description: The mute attribute toggles incoming signal output. This attribute is internally linked to the model's parameter audio/mute

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type attribute sets the type of the input (default = audio)
